glsa.title: Imlib 2: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities in Imlib 2 may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Imlib 2 is an advanced replacement library for libraries like libXpm.

description.p: Stefan Cornelius (Secunia Research) reported two boundary errors in Imlib2:

ul.li: One of them within the load() function in the file src/modules/loaders/loader_pnm.c when processing the header of a PNM image file, possibly leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.
The second one within the load() function in the file src/modules/loader_xpm.c when processing an XPM image file, possibly leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PNM or XPM image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application using Imlib 2.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Imlib 2 users should upgrade to the latest version:
